Line 24: Line 24:
==Modeling career==
==Modeling career==
  +
[[Twiggy promo.jpg|thumb|Twiggy during her modeling career]]
Twiggy is best remembered as the first ever international super-model and a fashion icon of the 1960s and 70s.<ref>http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/programmes/breakfast/4725427.stm The Face of '66</ref> In January of 1966, young Lesley Hornby had her hair colored and cut short in Mayfair by celebrity hairdresser Leonard.<ref>http://www.twiggylawson.co.uk/fashion.html The Twiggy Story</ref> A professional photographer named Barry Lategan took several photos, which Leonard hung in his salon. Deidre McSharry, a fashion journalist from ''The Daily Express'', saw the images and asked to meet with the young girl.<ref>http://blog.fidmmuseum.org/museum/2009/11/twiggy-.html FIDM Museum Blog</ref> A few weeks later, the publication featured an article and images of Lesley, declaring her "The Face of '66." <ref>http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/programmes/breakfast/4725427.stm The Face of '66</ref><ref>http://www.guardian.co.uk/lifeandstyle/2009/jul/08/twiggy-exhibition-national-portrait-gallery Face of 2009: Gallery Celebrates Twiggy's Career</ref> In it, the copy read: "The Cockney Kid with a face to launch a thousand shapes... and she's only 16! - ''The Daily Express'', February 23rd 1966.
Twiggy is best remembered as the first ever international super-model and a fashion icon of the 1960s and 70s.<ref>http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/programmes/breakfast/4725427.stm The Face of '66</ref> In January of 1966, young Lesley Hornby had her hair colored and cut short in Mayfair by celebrity hairdresser Leonard.<ref>http://www.twiggylawson.co.uk/fashion.html The Twiggy Story</ref> A professional photographer named Barry Lategan took several photos, which Leonard hung in his salon. Deidre McSharry, a fashion journalist from ''The Daily Express'', saw the images and asked to meet with the young girl.<ref>http://blog.fidmmuseum.org/museum/2009/11/twiggy-.html FIDM Museum Blog</ref> A few weeks later, the publication featured an article and images of Lesley, declaring her "The Face of '66." <ref>http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/programmes/breakfast/4725427.stm The Face of '66</ref><ref>http://www.guardian.co.uk/lifeandstyle/2009/jul/08/twiggy-exhibition-national-portrait-gallery Face of 2009: Gallery Celebrates Twiggy's Career</ref> In it, the copy read: "The Cockney Kid with a face to launch a thousand shapes... and she's only 16! - ''The Daily Express'', February 23rd 1966.
